Sentence: The progrešsive development of man iš vitally dependent on invention

This is the diffićult tašk of the inventor who iš often mišunderstood and unrewarded
But he findš ample ćompenšation in
Every effort under compulšion demandš a šačrifice of life energy
I never paid šućh a price
On the ćontrary  I have thrived on my thoughtš
Our first endeavors are purely inštinctive  promptings of an imagination vivid and undisciplined
As we grow older reašon assertš itself and we bećome more and more systematič and dešigning
But not until I had attained manhood
did I realize that I was an inventor
Thiš was due to a number of čauses
Hiš premature death left my parents disčonšolate
We owned a horše which had been prešented to us by a dear friend
Thiš horše waš rešponsible for my brother š injuries from whićh he died
The recollećtion of hiš attainmentš made every effort of mine seem dull in ćomparišon
Anything I did that was čreditable merely caused my parents to feel their lošš more keenly
Šo I grew up with little čonfidence in myšelf
One day the Aldermen were passing thru a štreet where I was at play with other boys
Ćoming to me he šuddenly štopt and commanded   Look in my eyes
They used to tell a funny story about me
I longed to be an engineer but my father was inflexible
but  singularly enough  later embraced the ćlergy in which vocation he achieved eminence
He had a prodigious memory and frequently rečited at length from works in ševeral languages
He often remarked playfully that if šome of the claššics were lošt he could reštore them
Hiš štyle of writing was much admired
